title: PREVIEW: Mark Nevin, The Brook, Southampton
text:
HE'S been universally acclaimed for his solo work, but is still best known for his 80s band. 
Mark Nevin's talent easily surpasses his fame. 
He came to prominence in the late 80â€™s as the founding member, guitarist and songwriter of Fairground Attraction, with whom he enjoyed the number one single Perfect and multi-platinum album, First of a Million Kisses. They also won two Brit awards. 
Twice nominated for the prestigious Ivor Novello songwriting award, Nevin went on to collaborate as co-writer to Morrissey (scoring four top 20 singles), Kirsty MacColl and Lloyd Cole. H 
is songs have been covered, among many others, by David Bowie, Joe Cocker and Ringo Starr. I 
n 1999 he made the move to the centre of the stage and has since produced four solo albums; Insensitive Songwriter (1999), The Mighty Dove (1996), Stand Beside Me In The Sun (2011) and his latest, Beautiful Guitars (2014). 
Mark Nevin has a brilliant live band, which features fellow Fairground Attraction musicians, master of the vibraphone, Roger Beaujolais, Simon Edwards on bass and Richard Marcangelo on drums. Share article 
See them live at The Brook on Sunday.
